data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: STEMI (ST-elevation myocardial infarction) or widowmaker is the most serious type of heart attack. A widowmaker heart attack happens when a full blockage of the left anterior descending artery (LAD) occurs. The left anterior descending artery (LAD) supplies 50% of heart muscle blood, Dr Venkatesh TK of Apollo Hospitals said. Heart attacks have become increasingly rampant in recent years.
data.title: What is a widowmaker heart attack?

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: From over 4,000 applicants, Japan's space agency JAXA on Tuesday chose a surgeon and a climate scientist as its first new astronauts in over 13 years. The chosen candidates include 28-year-old surgeon Ayu Yoneda and 46-year-old Makoto Suwa, a senior disaster risk management specialist. With this, Ayu will become the third woman in Japan to join the space training programme.
data.title: Surgeon, scientist named Japan's first new astronauts in 13 yrs

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: NASA astronaut Josh Cassada, who is currently aboard the International Space Station (ISS), captured a picture of auroras from space. He shared the picture on Twitter and called it absolutely unreal. The light shows caused by the interaction of charged solar particles with molecules in Earth's atmosphere have been supercharged recently by strong sun activity.
data.title: Absolutely unreal: NASA astronaut on pic of auroras from space

data.author: Apaar Sharma
data.content: Nearly 3,500 sea lions in Peru have recently died of H5N1 avian influenza, five times as many as previously reported, the government said on Thursday. The WHO recently warned that all the countries should take the risk from H5N1 bird flu virus seriously and urged for heightened vigilance after an 11-year-old girl in Cambodia died due to it.
data.title: Bird flu kills nearly 3,500 sea lions in Peru

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Nicola Fox, former top scientist on the Parker Solar Probe mission studying the sun, has been named NASA's science chief. A longtime solar scientist, Fox, heads NASA's heliophysics division. She would now lead NASA's science directorate, a unit that oversees some of NASA's best-known programs like robotic hunts for past life on Mars and exploring distant galaxies with Webb Telescope.
data.title: Solar physicist Nicola Fox named NASA's science chief

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: A 'doomsday' Arctic seed vault on Norway's Spitsbergen island is set to receive its most diverse batch of seed donations yet. The Svalbard Global Seed Vault will add 19,500 rare seed variety samples from across the world to its collection, taking its total stash to over 12 lakh. The vault, launched in 2008, has seed samples from nearly every country.
data.title: 'Doomsday' vault in Arctic gets 19,500 rare seed samples

data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: A giant insect found at a Walmart store in Arkansas, US in 2012 is the first of its kind recorded in eastern North America in over 50 years. The Polystoechotes punctata or giant lacewing was collected by Michael Skvarla, director of the Pennsylvania State University's Insect Identification Lab. During a class in 2020, he discovered the Jurassic-era insect's true identity.
data.title: Rare Jurassic-era bug found at a Walmart store in US; pic released

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: Mukesh Ambani's group is getting into genetic mapping as it will launch a ₹12,000 genome sequencing test, according to Ramesh Hariharan, Chief Executive Officer of Strand Life Sciences, which has developed the product. Reliance Industries, led by Mukesh Ambani, acquired the Bengaluru-based Strand Life Sciences in 2021 and now owns about 80% of it.
data.title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance to launch ₹12,000 genome sequencing test

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: A SpaceX Dragon capsule carrying two NASA astronauts, a Russian cosmonaut and a UAE astronaut arrived at the International Space Station (ISS) on Friday. As per NASA, the Dragon docked to the complex at 1:40 am EST, nearly 25 hours after its launch. Docking was delayed slightly as mission teams completed troubleshooting of a faulty docking hook sensor on Dragon.
data.title: SpaceX ship containing 4 astronauts docks to Space Station

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: SpaceX has launched the Crew-6 mission to the International Space Station for NASA, with a Russian cosmonaut and UAE astronaut, along with two NASA astronauts on board. The firm's first attempt to launch the mission was cancelled about two and a half minutes before it was scheduled to lift off. The crew will spend six months on the station.
data.title: SpaceX launches Crew-6 astronauts to space station for NASA

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: According to a study by researchers from the American College of Cardiology, regular consumption of marijuana can cause a heart attack. People who smoke cannabis or eat marijuana-laced food regularly are a third more likely to develop coronary artery disease, where cholesterol narrows the arteries supplying blood to organs, causing chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue, and even heart attack.
data.title: Regular cannabis consumption can cause heart attack: Study

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: The International Astronomical Union has named an asteroid after Pope Gregory XIII, the 16th-century pontiff behind the Gregorian calendar reform. The asteroid has been named '560974 Ugoboncompagni' after Gregory's birth name Ugo Boncompagni. He, along with an Italian astronomer and a Jesuit mathematician, corrected the Julian calendar, introducing a new method of calculating leap years.
data.title: Asteroid named after pope behind gregorian calendar reform

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Toilet paper contains potentially harmful PFAS that have been adding up to the forever chemicals in wastewater across the globe, which could also be leaching into soils via sewage, a study has found. While manufacturers add PFAS for converting wood into pulp while making toilet papers, even recycled toilet paper is made with fibres containing PFAS that eventually contaminate wastewater.
data.title: Toilet paper adding to 'forever chemicals' in wastewater: Study

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Researchers have discovered the oldest human genome, which belongs to a 23,000-year-old individual who lived in probably the warmest region of Europe at the peak of the last Ice Age. It was found at Cueva del Malalmuerzo in southern Spain. Researchers have also found a direct genetic link between this individual and a 35,000-year-old individual from Belgium.
data.title: Oldest human genome discovered in Spain

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Satellite images showed that Antarctica's glaciers that move along its coastline flow faster than usual in the summer. While the average speed of glaciers is around one kilometre each year, its speed has been found to increase by up to 22% in summer when temperatures are warmer. This happens due to melting snow and warmer ocean water, the study stated.
data.title: Antarctic glaciers flow faster in summers, satellite data shows

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Researchers have found that just one night of total sleep deprivation can make a person's brain appear years older. The research, published recently in the Journal of Neuroscience, suggested that participants who were subjected to total sleep deprivation showed increased brain age by 1-2 years. These changes were, however, reversible with recovery sleep, the study added.
data.title: Just a night without sleep can make brain seem years older: Study

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: NASA has shared a video of a series of photos of asteroid Dimorphos, taken by the Hubble telescope, when it was hit by the DART spacecraft in September. The impact had blasted over 1,000 tonnes of dust and rock off of the asteroid. The...movie offers invaluable...clues into how the debris was dispersed into a complex pattern...following the impact, NASA said.
data.title: NASA shares video on aftermath of DART's asteroid impact

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: NASA has tweeted images captured by the Hubble Space Telescope showing the aftermath of stars that died in a bright, powerful explosion known as a supernova. In a supernova, a star's contents fling out into space at speeds of up to...40,000 kmps! NASA's Hubble wrote. These supernova remnants are made of material from the exploded star, it added.
data.title: NASA shares pics by Hubble showing aftermath of stars' death

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Researchers believe they have discovered fossils of the earliest insects covered in pollen from around 280 million years back in Russia. The remains of these ancient earwig-like insects, known as tillyardembiids, were found in a lagoon. These extinct tillyardembiids had pollen preserved on their heads, thoraces, legs and abdomens, a researcher, Dr Alexander Khramov, said.
data.title: Fossils of insects in pollen from 280 mn yrs ago found in Russia

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Scientists have found a previously undiscovered moai statue in the bed of a dry lake in a volcano crater on Easter Island. The 1.6-metre tall moai will now undergo tests to determine what state it is in. Easter Island is a protected national park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. The statue is smaller than the island's other statues.
data.title: Previously undiscovered moai statue found on Easter Island

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Scientists have found new information about a 450-year-old supernova remnant called Tycho. The Tycho supernova was visible to the naked eye on Earth in 1572, and was probably described in an early passage of Hamlet by William Shakespeare, NASA said. Astronomers studying polarised X-rays from the remnant have seen the geometry of the magnetic fields close to the shock wave.
data.title: New data on 450-yr-old supernova likely stated in 'Hamlet' found

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: As different countries are planning to build their lunar bases, the moon should have its own timezone, European Space Agency (ESA) said. ESA's navigation system engineer Pietro Giordano highlighted the importance and urgency for synchronicity between Moon and Earth's time that all lunar systems and users may refer to. A joint international effort is being launched towards this, he said.
data.title: Moon should have its own timezone: ESA

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: China will soon start training foreign astronauts for trips to its new Tiangong space station. We will soon begin to select candidates...for joint flights to our space station, and they will be able to work with our astronauts to carry out scientific tasks in space, program official Chen Shanguang said. Multiple countries have asked China for rides, he added.
data.title: China to train foreign astronauts for its new space station

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: Artificial sweetener erythritol, a low-calorie sugar substitute used to sweeten products like Stevia, Aspartame etc is linked to higher risk of heart attack and stroke, a study stated. Though found in fruits, erythritol is not present in human body naturally and hence cannot be easily metabolised by the body. When consumed daily, erythritol can accumulate in the body, causing problems.
data.title: Artificial sweetener erythritol linked to heart attack: Study

data.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
data.content: Global energy-related emissions of carbon dioxide hit a record high in 2022, the International Energy Agency reported. Emissions caused by oil rose by 2.5% but remained below pre-pandemic levels. Besides this, emissions from coal jumped by 1.6% with many nations turning to the fuel after Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the consequent reduction in Russian gas supply to Europe.
data.title: Carbon dioxide emissions reached a record high in 2022: IEA
